title: INACIA: Integrating Large Language Models in Brazilian Audit Courts: Opportunities and Challenges
authors: Jayr Pereira, Andre Assumpcao, Julio Trecenti, Luiz Airosa, Caio Lente, Jhonatan Cléto, Guilherme Dobins, Rodrigo Nogueira, Luis Mitchell, and Roberto Lotufo
abstract: This paper explores the integration of large language models in Brazilian audit courts, examining opportunities and challenges for improving governmental transparency and efficiency through AI technologies.

title: A Journey through Time: the Story Behind 'Eight Decades of Changes in Occupational Tasks, Computerization and the Gender Pay Gap'
authors: Leo Schmallenbach, Ljubica Nedelkoska, Shreyas Gadgin Matha, James McNerney, Andre Assumpcao, Dario Diodato, and Frank Neffke
abstract: An analysis of occupational task changes over eight decades and their implications for computerization and the gender pay gap, providing insights into labor market evolution.

title: Electoral Crime Under Democracy: Information Effects from Judicial Decisions in Brazil
abstract: This paper examines the information effects of judicial decisions on electoral crime under democratic governance in Brazil, analyzing how court rulings influence electoral behavior and democratic accountability.

title: Judicial Favoritism of Politicians: Evidence from Small Claims Courts
abstract: This paper investigates evidence of judicial favoritism toward politicians in small claims courts, examining potential bias in judicial decision-making and its implications for democratic governance and rule of law.

title: Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC): What are the Variables that Impact the Success of the Projects Currently running in Brazil?
authors: Fernando Berssaneti, Andre Assumpcao, Oswaldo Nakao
abstract: This study examines the key variables that impact the success of Engineering, Procurement, and Construction projects in Brazil, providing insights for project management optimization.
